summary: This is an FBI internal request form from the Miami Division to the Document Conversion Laboratory (DocLab) and Special Technologies and Applications Office (STAG) to scan and process telephone records related to the obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez. The document reveals Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager, attempted to sell an address book believed to contain names of additional underage victims rather than surrender it to authorities.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein; subject of obstruction of justice case
persons.context: The subject of FBI case 72-MM-113327 for obstruction of justice. He allegedly came into possession of an address book containing names and numbers of potential underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein and attempted to sell it.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: Identified as the individual whose former house manager, Alfredo Rodriguez, possessed an address book believed to contain information on his underage victims.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Miami Division opens obstruction case against Rodriguez
events.description: The FBI's Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: FBI requests document conversion for telephone records
events.description: The FBI Miami Division submitted a formal request to the Document Conversion Laboratory to scan and process telephone records obtained from an address book in the Rodriguez case for incorporation into the Telephone Application (TA) system.

locations: Winchester, Virginia (Location of the FBI Document Conversion Laboratory)
keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager, was the subject of an FBI obstruction of justice case opened in October 2009.
Rodriguez came into possession of an address book believed to contain names and telephone numbers of additional, previously unknown underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez attempted to sell the address book rather than turn it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas.
The FBI was processing telephone records obtained from this address book, believed to belong to Epstein, his associates, or potential underage victims.
This document is an internal FBI request for technical assistance to scan and digitize these records for analysis and storage in the Bureau's investigative database.
